translated: The Paṭṭhāna Treatise🔽The reverse order of the dependent origination, the triplets in the Paṭṭhāna text

analyzed: dhamma paccanīya anuloma duka tika paṭṭhāna pāḷi  saññojana ādi chaga ucchaka kusala ttika
translated: The section on the spheres of the fetters, etc., the triplets on the wholesome

original: Nasaññojanaṁ naakusalaṁ dhammaṁ paccayā saññojano akusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na saññojanam na akusalam dhammam paccayā saññojanaḥ akusalaḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: With the condition of a non-fetter that is unwholesome, a fetter that is unwholesome arises, with root-cause condition. (Abbreviated.)
With root-cause as condition, there are three. … With the unformed as condition, there are three.

original: Naganthaṁ naakusalaṁ dhammaṁ paccayā gantho akusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na gantham na akusalam dhammam paccayā ganthaḥ akusalaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: With the condition of a non-tie that is unwholesome, a tie that is unwholesome arises, with root-cause condition. (Abbreviated.)
With root-cause as condition, there are three. … With the unformed as condition, there are three.

original: Naoghaṁ naakusalaṁ dhammaṁ paccayā ogho akusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na ogham na akusalam dhammam paccayā oghaḥ akusalaḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: With the condition of a non-flood that is unwholesome, a flood that is unwholesome arises, with root-cause condition. (Abbreviated.)
With root-cause as condition, there are three. … With the unformed as condition, there are three.

original: Nayogaṁ naakusalaṁ dhammaṁ paccayā yogo akusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na yogam na akusalam dhammam paccayā yogaḥ akusalaḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: With the condition of a non-bond that is unwholesome, a bond that is unwholesome arises, with root-cause condition. (Abbreviated.)
With root-cause as condition, there are three. … With the unformed as condition, there are three.

original: Nanīvaraṇaṁ naakusalaṁ dhammaṁ paccayā nīvaraṇo akusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na nīvaraṇam na akusalam dhammam paccayā nīvaraṇaḥ akusalaḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: With an object that is not an obstruction, from a unwholesome object arises an obstruction, an unwholesome object, by way of condition being a cause. (In brief.)
With a cause, there are three. … With an unobscured, there are three.

original: Naparāmāsaṁ naakusalaṁ dhammaṁ paccayā parāmāso akusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na parāmāsam na akusalam dhammam paccayā parāmāsaḥ akusalaḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: With an object that is not clinging, from a unwholesome object arises clinging, an unwholesome object, by way of condition being a cause. (In brief.)
With a cause, there are three. … With an unobscured, there are three.
